intro: Gouania trichodonta, commonly known as the hairy gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Gouania trichodonta is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
